paper_abstract: In this paper we propose an efficient approach to the compressed string matching problem on Huffman encoded texts, based on the BOYER-MOORE strategy. Once a candidate valid shift has been located, a subsequent verification phase checks whether the shift is codeword aligned by taking advantage of the skeleton tree data structure. Our approach leads to algorithms that exhibit a sublinear behavior on the average, as shown by extensive experimentation.
paper_title: ADAPTING BOYER-MOORE-LIKE ALGORITHMS FOR SEARCHING HUFFMAN ENCODED TEXTS
